abstract: Bank of America Merrill Lynch has hired Brian McCarthy from Oppenheimer & Company as a vice chairman of health care investment banking, the firm announced on Monday in an internal memorandum reviewed by DealBook.
snippet: Bank of America Merrill Lynch has hired Brian McCarthy from Oppenheimer & Company as a vice chairman of health care investment banking, the firm announced on Monday in an internal memorandum reviewed by DealBook.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America Merrill Lynch has hired Brian McCarthy as a vice chairman of health care investment banking, the firm announced on Monday in an internal memorandum reviewed by DealBook. Mr. McCarthy came over from Oppenheimer & Company, where he was the head of the health care investment banking team, and previously worked at JPMorgan Chase and Lehman Brothers.

headline.main: Bank of America Hires Senior Oppenheimer Health Care Banker

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: The JPMorgan Chase chief executive, who will testify on Tuesday before the House Financial Services Committee, plans to stick to the script from his first appearance last week on Capitol Hill, with prepared remarks that are virtually identical.
snippet: The JPMorgan Chase chief executive, who will testify on Tuesday before the House Financial Services Committee, plans to stick to the script from his first appearance last week on Capitol Hill, with prepared remarks that are virtually identical.
lead_paragraph: Anyone hoping that Jamie Dimon‘s second round of prepared Congressional testimony will reveal the full story behind his bank’s multibillion-dollar trading loss — or any fresh details for that matter — is in for a disappointing read.

headline.main: In House Testimony, Dimon Sticks to Script
